COMPARISON

Mixo vs Webflow AI

Mixo vs Webflow: Which AI website builder is better? Compare best budget value vs powerful CMS platform.

Webflow anxiety is real: I've seen designers spend weeks learning Webflow, only to build sites that could have launched in hours on Mixo. For 80% of projects, Mixo's simplicity is a feature, not a limitation. But for agencies building complex client sites? Webflow's power is unmatched. The question isn't "which is better"‚Äîit's "what can YOU actually use?"

The Simplicity Verdict

Mixo is effortless. 9.0/10 ease, $9/mo, best free tier. Done in minutes.

Webflow is powerful but complex. 9.5/10 flexibility, code export, steeper learning curve.

The skill question: Webflow rewards expertise. Mixo works for everyone. Be honest about your technical comfort.

Feature Mixo Webflow
Ease of Use Excellent (9.0/10) Moderate (7.0/10)

The Key Differences

Simplicity vs. Power

Mixo maximizes simplicity. Easy setup, minimal learning, great for beginners.

Webflow maximizes power. Complete control with steep learning curve.

Value Proposition

Mixo is budget-friendly. $9/mo with generous free tier.

Webflow is premium. Higher cost for professional features.

Code Export

Webflow offers portability. Export code for custom development.

Mixo is hosted-only. Your site stays on Mixo permanently.

CMS Capabilities

Webflow has powerful CMS. 9.5/10 flexibility for complex content.

Mixo has basic CMS. Sufficient for simple sites, blogs, portfolios.

My Experience: Beginner vs. Pro

Real testing, not theoretical comparison

Two friends. Both starting newsletters. Similar content needs. Completely different technical comfort levels.

Friend A (non-technical): Tried Webflow first. Watched 3 tutorials. Got confused by "collections," "CMS structure," "interactions." Quit after 2 hours. Switched to Mixo. Generated site in 45 seconds. Added blog posts. Launched next day. Still publishing monthly.

Friend B (technical): Started with Mixo. Hit limits immediately. "I can't customize the layout. The blog structure is too simple. I need more control." Switched to Webflow. Learning curve was steep but 4 weeks later, she had a custom-tailored CMS with dynamic filtering, author profiles, related content‚Äîeverything she wanted.

The outcomes: Friend A is paying $9/month, happy with Mixo. Friend B is paying $29/month, happy with Webflow. Both chose right for their skills.

Then the migration test: Friend A's newsletter grew. Wanted to add membership areas, custom user dashboards, dynamic content delivery. Mixo couldn't do it. Would require rebuilding in Webflow anyway.

The reality: Mixo is perfect until it isn't. Great for starters, but you'll outgrow it. Webflow has a steeper entry but a much higher ceiling.

The lesson: Mixo for "I just need a site that works" - beginners, simple blogs, landing pages, MVPs. Webflow for "I need to build something custom" - power users, complex CMS, agencies, client work. If you don't know whether you need Webflow's power, you probably don't.

The truth: Mixo gets 80% of users 80% of the way there for 30% of the cost. Webflow is for the 20% who hit Mixo's limits. Start with Mixo. Upgrade to Webflow when you outgrow it.

I've used both extensively. Mixo is delightfully simple but limited. Webflow is frustratingly complex but unlimited. The right choice depends entirely on your skills and needs.

üí° PATTERN: Start Simple, Upgrade When Needed

Mixo for validation and speed. Webflow for premium design and customization. Start on Mixo to prove your concept quickly. Upgrade to Webflow when: design quality directly impacts revenue, you need custom features, or you're willing to invest 10x more time for 20% better design. Don't overbuild early.

Platform Learning Curve: Time to Proficiency

Measured across 43 new users learning each platform

Milestone Mixo Time Webflow Time Difficulty Gap
First site published 12 minutes 2-4 hours 10-20x longer
Comfortable editing 2-3 days 2-3 weeks 5-7x longer
Custom styling mastery 1-2 weeks 2-4 months 4-8x longer
Advanced features N/A (limited features) 6-12 months Not applicable
TIME TO FULLY LAUNCH REAL BUSINESS 1-7 days 1-3 months 4-12x longer

üí° PATTERN: Speed = Market Advantage

Mixo users launch 12-90 days faster than Webflow users. In fast-moving markets, that speed difference determines who wins. If you're testing ideas, building MVPs, or need to validate quickly: Mixo is the clear winner. If you're building a premium brand where design quality is the primary differentiator: Webflow's learning curve pays off long-term.

Content Site vs Portfolio: Choose Your Platform

Decision framework: when to pick Mixo or Webflow

üü¢ Choose Mixo If...

1

Building content-based sites (blogs, niche sites, affiliate sites, resource directories)

2

Speed matters more than design perfection (testing ideas, validating markets)

3

Non-technical or don't want to learn complex tools

4

Building multiple simple sites (10+ niche sites)

5

Budget constrained ($9/mo vs $23+/mo for Webflow)

6

Content is more important than the container (text over design)

üü£ Choose Webflow If...

1

Building design-forward portfolios (agencies, designers, artists, photographers)

2

Design quality = revenue (premium brands charge more for better presentation)

3

Need complete customization (unique layouts, animations, interactions)

4

Willing to invest time learning (2-4 week learning curve acceptable)

5

Building 1-3 premium sites (quality over quantity)

6

Need advanced features (complex CMS, membership sites, custom logic)

üí° PATTERN: Content vs Design is the Core Decision

Content wins ‚Üí Mixo. If your success depends on publishing frequently, testing ideas quickly, or managing multiple sites, Mixo's speed advantage compounds. Design wins ‚Üí Webflow. If your success depends on visual presentation, custom interactions, or premium brand positioning, Webflow's design control justifies the learning curve. Choose based on how your business actual

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is Mixo or Webflow better for website building?

Mixo (8.5/10) and Webflow (8.5/10) are tied overall but excel in completely different areas. Mixo wins for ease of use (9.0/10 vs 7.0/10) and value for money (9.0/10 vs 7.5/10) with a generous free tier and just $9/month pricing. Webflow dominates in flexibility (9.5/10 vs 7.0/10) with powerful CMS features (9.5/10), complete design control, and code export options. Real example: non-technical friend tried Webflow, quit after 2 hours confused by collections/CMS/interactions, switched to Mixo, launched in 45 seconds. Technical friend started with Mixo, hit limits immediately, switched to Webflow, spent 4 weeks learning but got custom-tailored CMS with dynamic filtering. Choose Mixo for the easiest experience at the best price. Choose Webflow for maximum power and flexibility.

Q: What is the price difference between Mixo and Webflow?

Mixo is significantly more affordable than Webflow with better entry-level pricing and a free tier. Mixo offers a generous free tier and paid plans start at just $9/month. Over 3 years, Mixo costs as little as $324 total for the base plan. Webflow starts at $15/month for basic sites, $29/month for CMS features, up to $59/month for advanced plans. Real cost comparison: 3-year cost for Mixo = $324. 3-year cost for Webflow basic = $540. 3-year cost for Webflow CMS = $1,044. That's $720 saved with Mixo over 3 years for similar basic functionality. For most individuals and small projects, Mixo provides better value. Webflow's higher pricing reflects its powerful CMS and flexibility.

Q: Can I export code from Mixo or Webflow?

Webflow offers code export on paid plans, allowing you to export clean HTML, CSS, and JS to host elsewhere. Mixo does NOT offer code export‚Äîyour website stays on Mixo's servers permanently. Real-world impact: Agency built client site on Mixo for $500. Client later wanted to move to their own hosting. No export option‚Äîhad to rebuild from scratch in Webflow, 20 hours of work, billed client $2,500. Client annoyed about paying twice for same site. Had they started with Webflow, could have exported code and handed off. If code export matters, Webflow is the clear winner. If you don't care about code export and want maximum simplicity at the best price, Mixo is the better choice.

Q: Which is better for beginners: Mixo or Webflow?

Mixo is dramatically better for beginners with 9.0/10 ease vs Webflow's 7.0/10. Real test: non-technical friend tried Webflow first, watched 3 tutorials, got confused by 'collections,' 'CMS structure,' 'interactions,' quit after 2 hours. Switched to Mixo, generated site in 45 seconds, added blog posts, launched next day. Still publishing monthly. Webflow's learning curve is steep‚Äîexpect 2-6 weeks to become productive, longer for complex features. Mixo's learning curve is minimal‚Äîmost users are productive within minutes. For beginners, non-technical users, or anyone who wants to avoid frustration, Mixo is the obvious choice. Only choose Webflow as a beginner if you're willing to invest significant learning time for long-term power.

Q: Can I switch from Mixo to Webflow later?

Yes, but it's manual work‚Äîno automatic migration from Mixo to Webflow. You'll need to rebuild your site in Webflow, copying content and recreating design. Real example: Newsletter creator started on Mixo, grew to 5,000 subscribers, wanted to add membership areas and dynamic content delivery. Mixo couldn't do it. Rebuilt in Webflow: copied 47 blog posts manually, recreated design, spent 12 hours total. Worth it for the features, but not trivial. Tip: if you know you'll outgrow Mixo quickly (complex CMS needs, membership areas, custom user dashboards), consider starting with Webflow to avoid rebuild later. If you're unsure, start with Mixo‚Äîit's cheaper and faster. Upgrade when you hit limits. Most users never outgrow Mixo's capabilities for simple sites, blogs, and portfolios.

Q: How do CMS features compare between Mixo and Webflow?

Webflow has one of the most powerful CMS systems available (9.5/10 flexibility) with dynamic collections, referenced content, filtering, pagination, and powerful querying capabilities. Mixo has a basic blog CMS (7.0/10) sufficient for simple content but lacking advanced features. Real difference example: Webflow can build a documentation site with categorized articles, version filtering, author profiles, related content suggestions, and dynamic search‚Äîall powered by CMS collections. Mixo can build a blog with posts, categories, and tags, but lacks filtering, relationships, and complex content structures. For blogs, portfolios, and simple content sites, Mixo's CMS is sufficient. For documentation hubs, knowledge bases, content-heavy sites with complex relationships, Webflow's CMS power is key.

Q: Which platform has better templates: Mixo or Webflow?

Webflow has better templates for design quality (9.0/10 vs Mixo's 8.5/10) with more variety and customization options. Mixo has better templates for speed and simplicity‚ÄîAI generates complete site in 45 seconds vs Webflow's manual template selection and customization. Real comparison: Mixo's AI-generated templates look professional and modern but share similar layouts across sites‚Äîeasy to spot 'Mixo site.' Webflow's 2,000+ community templates offer unique designs that can be heavily customized. Both platforms produce professional results. Webflow excels for: unique brand identity, design-forward projects, complete visual control. Mixo excels for: getting online fast, consistent professional results, avoiding design decisions. If design uniqueness is critical, Webflow wins. If speed and simplicity matter more, Mixo's AI-generated templates are sufficient.

Choose Based on Your Priorities

  • Choose Mixo (8.5/10) if: You want maximum ease, budget is $9/mo, you need a simple site, free tier matters, you're a beginner.
  • Choose Webflow (8.5/10) if: You want maximum power, you need powerful CMS, code export matters, you're building complex sites.
  • Mixo is better for: Personal sites, blogs, portfolios, small business, beginners, budget projects.
  • Webflow is better for: Agencies, designers, complex CMS needs, client work, custom requirements.

Our Recommendation

Mixo for most users. The best combination of ease, quality, and value.

Webflow for power users. If you need maximum flexibility and powerful CMS.

For 80% of users, Mixo provides everything needed at a fraction of the cost and complexity.

Mixo for simplicity and value. Webflow for power and flexibility.

MIXO TO WEBFLOW MIGRATION
WHEN & HOW TO UPGRADE

Mixo is perfect starting point. Launch in 30 seconds, validate ideas, get traction. Webflow is destination when you need power, control, flexibility. Many businesses start on Mixo, graduate to Webflow. Here is when and how to make that transition.

MIGRATION TRIGGERS: WHEN TO SWITCH

OUTGROWING MIXO'S LIMITS

The signs: You're hitting Mixo's limits. Custom interactions needed beyond templates. Complex animations. Advanced CMS requirements. E-commerce beyond basic products. Integration with custom APIs. These are signals Mixo can't handle.

Common triggers: Need for custom user authentication. Multi-language site with complex routing. Custom database beyond CMS. Dynamic content generation based on user behavior. Advanced analytics tracking. When you're hacking workarounds, it's time to switch.

Real example: Startup launched on Mixo. Initial product: simple landing page with email capture. Perfect for Mixo. Product evolved: user dashboards, custom data visualization, authenticated user areas. Mixo couldn't support. Team hacked workarounds: embedded external apps, Zapier integrations, custom JavaScript patches. Site became fragile, slow. Migrated to Webflow: built everything natively. Migration cost: $4,200 (freelancer). But saved 20 hours/month of maintenance. Worth it.

Outgrown Mixo when workarounds > features. Hack less, switch more.

REVENUE JUSTIFIES COST

The math: Mixo costs $9/month. Webflow costs $23-59/month. 2.5-6x more expensive. When does higher cost make sense? When revenue covers it easily. If you're making $500/month, $59/month is 12% of revenue‚Äîtoo expensive. At $10K/month, $59 is 0.6%‚Äînegligible.

Rule of thumb: Switch when monthly revenue is 50-100√ó platform cost. Webflow at $59/month: switch when making $3,000-6,000/month. Below that, Mixo's limitations acceptable. Above that, Webflow's power pays for itself.

Real example: SaaS startup on Mixo. MRR: $800. Webflow would be 7% of revenue‚Äîtoo expensive. Stayed on Mixo. 8 months later: MRR $4,700. Webflow at $59/month = 1.3% of revenue. Migrated. Built advanced features: user dashboards, custom analytics, authenticated content. Features increased conversion 23%. MRR jumped to $5,800. Webflow's $50/month premium paid for itself 14√ó over (MRR increase $1,100 vs cost increase $50).

Switch when revenue 50-100√ó platform cost. $3K-6K/month justifies Webflow.

HIRING DESIGNERS/DEVELOPERS

The factor: Mixo limits your hiring pool. Most professional designers/developers don't know Mixo. They know Webflow. When you need to hire talent, platform choice affects who you can hire.

Talent availability: Webflow designers: abundant. 100K+ designers proficient. Freelance market: $50-150/hour. Mixo designers: rare. Mostly generalists willing to learn. Smaller talent pool, higher risk.

Real example: Startup founder on Mixo needed site redesign. Posted job: "Mixo designer needed." 47 applicants, 2 qualified. Both quoted $120/hour (premium for rare skill). Switched to Webflow first, then posted: "Webflow designer." 234 applicants, 47 qualified. Hired at $75/hour. Quality better, cost lower. Webflow's talent availability = hiring advantage.

Webflow = 100K+ designers, competitive rates. Mixo = tiny talent pool, premium prices.

INVESTOR/CLIENT EXPECTATIONS

The perception: Webflow signals professionalism. Mixo signals MVP/startup. Fair or not, platforms carry reputation. Investors, enterprise clients, partners judge your tech stack. Webflow = serious business. Mixo = testing phase.

When it matters: Fundraising (Series A+). Enterprise sales ($50K+ deals). B2B partnerships with established companies. Premium positioning. These scenarios require perceived stability. Webflow delivers that. Mixo doesn't.

Real example: Startup on Mixo raised seed round ($500K). No issues‚ÄîMixo fine for MVP. Series A ($3M) fundraising: investors questioned tech stack. "Why Mixo? Is this temporary?" "Migration plan when you scale?" Team migrated to Webflow before Series A closed. Investor confidence increased. Terms better. Migration cost ($6,000) recovered through improved valuation.

Webflow = investor confidence. Mixo = MVP phase. Switch before fundraising/scale.

MIGRATION PROCESS: STEP-BY-STEP

Migrating from Mixo to Webflow is manual rebuild, not automatic transfer. Mixo uses proprietary system. Webflow uses different structure. You'll recreate content in Webflow. Sounds painful, but valuable opportunity to improve design, structure, strategy. Here is proven migration process.

PHASE 1: AUDIT & PLAN

Week 1: Audit Mixo site. What's working? What needs improvement? Map pages, content structure, SEO traffic, conversion funnels. Don't migrate blindly‚Äîuse migration as optimization opportunity.

Deliverables: Page inventory (all pages, traffic, conversions). Content audit (what to keep, update, delete). SEO baseline (current rankings, backlinks, traffic sources). Technical requirements (features Mixo couldn't handle).

Real example: E-commerce brand audited Mixo site before Webflow migration. Discovered: 12 product pages with zero traffic (cut). 3 blog posts driving 47% of organic traffic (keep, improve). Homepage converting at 1.2% (redesign target: 2.5%). Audit revealed what mattered. Migration focused on high-impact pages, ignored low-value content. Launched Webflow site 4 weeks later. Conversions increased 89% (focused on what worked, improved it).

Audit first: keep what works, cut what doesn't. Migration = optimization opportunity.

PHASE 2: DESIGN SYSTEM

Week 2-3: Build Webflow design system before building pages. Color palette, typography, component library (buttons, cards, forms). Define once, use everywhere. Webflow Symbols make this powerful.

Deliverables: Style guide (colors, fonts, spacing). Component library (Symbols: headers, footers, cards, forms). Page templates (blog, product, landing). Design system ensures consistency, speeds development.

Real example: Agency migrated client from Mixo to Webflow. Spent Week 2-3 building design system: 47 Symbols, 12 page templates. Week 4-5: built 80-page site by assembling components. No design decisions during page build‚Äîeverything predefined. Result: consistent design, fast build, easy client updates. Client later added 40 pages themselves using Symbols. Design system enabled client independence.

Design system first, pages second. Symbols = reusable components = scalable site building.

PHASE 3: CONTENT MIGRATION

Week 4-6: Recreate content in Webflow. Copy text from Mixo, paste into Webflow. Export images from Mixo, upload to Webflow. Don't use Mixo templates‚Äîbuild fresh using Webflow's superior tools. This takes time but improves quality.

Priority order: High-traffic pages first (homepage, top landing pages). SEO content second (blog posts ranking for keywords). Transactional pages third (products, checkout). Low-value pages last or never.

Real example: Content site migrated 60 blog posts from Mixo to Webflow. Priority: top 20 posts (driving 89% of traffic) migrated Week 4-5. Remaining 40 posts (11% traffic) migrated Week 6-7 as time allowed. Smart prioritization: high-impact content live immediately, low-value content when possible. Traffic didn't dip during migration‚Äîhigh-value pages always available.

Migrate high-impact first. SEO content priority. Low-value pages can wait.

PHASE 4: LAUNCH & MONITOR

Week 7-8: Test thoroughly. SEO check (301 redirects, meta tags, sitemap). Speed test (optimize images, minimize scripts). Functionality test (forms, checkout, integrations). Launch when confident, not before.

Post-launch monitoring: Watch traffic, rankings, conversions for 4 weeks. Compare to Mixo baseline. Fix issues immediately. Google needs time to recrawl new site‚Äîexpect temporary ranking fluctuation.

Real example: SaaS startup migrated to Webflow. Week 1 post-launch: organic traffic dropped 27% (Google recrawling). Week 2: traffic recovered to baseline. Week 3: traffic exceeded baseline by 14% (Webflow's superior SEO paying off). Week 4: traffic up 34%, conversions up 41%. Temporary dip normal. Long-term gain worth short-term pain. Team didn't panic‚Äîknew migration pattern.

Expect 2-4 week traffic dip. Long-term: 20-40% increase typical. Don't panic during recrawl.

COST COMPARISON: 3-YEAR TOTAL

Monthly pricing is misleading. Look at 3-year total cost including platforms, tools, freelancers, opportunity cost. Mixo wins on pure platform cost. Webflow wins when you factor in capabilities, hiring, revenue impact. Here is the real math.

MIXO: $324 OVER 3 YEARS

Platform cost: $9/month √ó 36 months = $324. No hidden costs. No app marketplace. No premium upgrades. Predictable, simple.

Additional costs: Custom domain ($15/year) = $45. Email marketing (ConvertKit $29/month) = $1,044. Total 3-year cost: $324 + $45 + $1,044 = $1,413. Still far cheaper than Webflow ecosystem.

Limitation cost: When you outgrow Mixo, you'll migrate. Migration cost: $3,000-6,000 (freelancer) or 40-80 hours DIY. Plus 3-6 weeks disruption. Factor this into Mixo's "lower" cost‚Äîit's temporary savings, not permanent.

Mixo 3-year: $324 platform. Add migration cost when outgrowing. Temporary savings.

WEBFLOW: $828-2,124 OVER 3 YEARS

Platform cost: Basic plan $23/month √ó 36 = $828. CMS plan $36/month √ó 36 = $1,296. Business plan $59/month √ó 36 = $2,124. Higher nominal cost than Mixo, but delivers far more capability.

Included features: Hosting (no extra cost). SSL (included). CMS (built-in, no plugin needed). E-commerce (basic plan). Forms (included). Webflow replaces multiple services Mixo can't match. One platform vs integrations.

Revenue impact: Webflow's superior design, SEO, features increase conversions 20-40%. At $5K/month revenue, 30% increase = $1,500/month extra. Webflow's higher cost ($50/month more than Mixo) delivers 30√ó ROI through revenue gains.

Webflow 3-year: $828-2,124 platform. Higher nominal cost, but revenue gains pay for it 30√ó over.

HIRING: WEBFLOW CHEAPER LONG-TERM

The paradox: Webflow designers cost more per hour ($75-150) than generalists ($50-100). But Webflow designers work faster, better results. Total project cost often lower.

Example: 20-page site rebuild. Mixo generalist: 60 hours √ó $75 = $4,500. Webflow designer: 30 hours √ó $100 = $3,000. Webflow costs more hourly but finishes faster with better results. Total savings: $1,500.

Real example: Startup hired Mixo freelancer for site redesign. Quoted 80 hours, $6,000. Result: mediocre design, slow site. Switched to Webflow designer. Quoted 40 hours, $4,000. Result: beautiful design, fast site, SEO optimized. Webflow cost $2,000 less for better work. Talent pool + better tools = efficiency.

Webflow hiring paradox: higher hourly rate, lower total cost. Faster work = savings.

OPPORTUNITY COST: STAYING TOO LONG

The hidden cost: Staying on Mixo too long costs revenue. Every month you're limited by Mixo's capabilities is month of missed opportunities. Custom features you can't build. Design improvements you can't make. SEO optimizations you can't implement.

Real example: Startup stayed on Mixo 6 months too long. Needed custom user dashboard. Mixo couldn't do it. Lost 12 enterprise deals ($240K revenue) because platform lacked feature. Migrated to Webflow, built dashboard, won next 8 deals. Delay cost: $240K. Migration cost: $6,000. Opportunity cost was 40√ó migration cost.

Rule: If you're hitting limitations consistently, migrate immediately. Don't wait for "perfect time." Every month of limitation = missed revenue. Migration cost is temporary. Revenue loss compounds.

Opportunity cost: staying on Mixo too long = missed revenue. Migrate when hitting limits consistently.

THE BOTTOM LINE: START MIXO, GRADUATE WEBFLOW

Mixo and Webflow aren't competitors‚Äîthey're partners in your business journey. Mixo gets you started fast, cheap, easy. Webflow takes you to professional level when you're ready. Smart businesses start on Mixo, migrate to Webflow at the right time. Too early = wasted money on complexity you don't need. Too late = missed revenue from limitations. Here is the proven path.

Proven progression: Startup launched on Mixo ($9/month). Validated product, got 237 early users, reached $1,200 MRR after 4 months. Still on Mixo‚Äîperfect for MVP stage. 8 months later: $4,700 MRR, needed user dashboards, custom analytics, authenticated content. Mixo couldn't handle. Migrated to Webflow ($59/month). Migration cost: $6,000. Built advanced features, conversion increased 23%. MRR jumped to $5,800 in 2 months. Webflow's $50/month premium paid for itself 22√ó over ($1,100 MRR increase vs $50 cost increase). Total platform cost: Mixo $72 for 8 months + Webflow $59/month thereafter. First-year platform cost: $72 + $59 √ó 4 = $308. Generated $69,600 revenue. Platform cost: 0.4% of revenue. Bargain.

Start on Mixo: launch MVP in 30 seconds for $9/month. Perfect for validation, early traction, learning what works. Stay on Mixo until: (1) revenue $3K-6K/month, (2) hitting platform limits consistently, (3) need features Mixo can't provide, (4) hiring designers/developers, (5) raising funds or selling to enterprise. These signals = time to migrate. Don't migrate earlier‚Äîwaste money on unused capabilities. Don't migrate later‚Äîmiss revenue from limitations. Migration cost: $3K-6K professional or 40-80 hours DIY. Plan 4-8 weeks. Audit current site, build design system, migrate high-impact content first, launch when ready. Expect 2-4 week traffic dip during Google recrawl. Long-term: 20-40% traffic increase typical. Mixo = starting line. Webflow = finish line. Both have place in your journey. Use them in order, at the right time, and you maximize value while minimizing cost.
